Video.Title: Transparent view of a Nacelle
Video.Help: This video provides a travelling view of a nacelle, with transparent walls

Video.Title: Guided visit to a Wind Turbine
Virtual Wind Farm Tour Ep 5: The Nacelle
Video.Help: This video the preparation stage of an intervention on a Wind Turbine

Video.Title: Key concepts of Wind Energy and Wind Turbines
Video.Help: This video presents a short presentation of the basics concepts on Wind Turbines

Video.Title: Description of one Wind Turbine simulator
Video.Help: This video contains a short introduction to the Simulator for the Wind Turbine with Active Stall control.

Video.Title: START and STOP operations of a Wind Turbine
Video.Help: In this video you can observe the evolution of the Wind Turbine of the Active Stall type, with squirrel cage electric Generator directly connected to the Grid, during two basic operations: START (from disconnected from the Grid to connection, and start production - cutin-), and STOP (from production state to stop state - cutout).

Video.Title: Evolution of the internal signals of a DFIG Wind Turbine wth windgusts
Video.Help:
This video presents a detailed analysis of the evolution of several key signals inside a DFIG.
It also presents the case of windgusts.

Video.Title: Evolution of a DFIG during a windgust with problems in the Pitch system - High Wind Speed
Video.Help: This video shows the evolution of the Drive Train of a 1.5 MW Wind Turbine, with high wind speed, under two different operational conditions: a) normal, and b) with problems in the Pitch system

Video.Title: Evolution of a DFIG Drive Train with wind gusts, and problems in the Pitch System - Low Wind Speed
Video.Help: This video shows the evolution of the Drive Train of a 1.5 MW Wind Turbine, with low wind speed, under two different operational conditional conditions: a) normal, and b) with problems in the Pitch system

Video.Title: Management of incidences
Video.Help:
Incidences are a key concept in Wind Turbines: Wind Turbines are Production Plants, designed to operate in stand-alone mode, adapting their behavior to the changing conditions (wind speed, wind direction, failures in the Grid, internal failures, etc.)
Whenever a subsystem is not working properly, or some variable goes out of range, the Wind Turbine's Controller supplies information (incidence) that can be used to analyse the actual condition of the Wind Turbine.
Familiarity with the possible incidences in a Wind Turbine is a must for anyone involved in its Operation and Maintenance.

Video.Title: Erection of a Wind Turbine - MidAmerican Energy -
Use of WindFarmSimulator suite in Minnesota West Technical College
Video.Help: This video by West Technical College presents their installations for Training in Wind Turbine technologies. It shows our WindFarmSimulator in use.

Video.Title: Construction of Wind Turbine subsystems
Video.Help: Videos showing the construction of different subsystems of a Wind Turbine, notably the Yaw system in the Nacelle.

Video.Title: Visit inside a Wind Turbine
Wind Turbine Aerodynamics: Stall vs Pitch Regulation
Video.Help: This video shows the difference between the physical principles behind the two most used methods for controlling the intake of power from the wind

Video.Title: Transparent view of a Nacelle
Video.Help: This video provides a travelling view of a nacelle, with transparent walls

Video.Title: How a Planetary stage works
Video.Help:
The Gearbox of a Wind Turbine have a speed transformation among its axis in the range of 1:60 to 1:125, obtained using several stages.
Often the first one is a Planetary stage, connected to the Hub.
